content.question: If <math alttext="g of x, equals, 2 times the natural log of, open parenthesis, x plus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a differentiable function of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is equivalent to the derivative of <math alttext="f of, open parenthesis, g of x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f prime of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator x plus 1, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
